title: How to Create a Poll on a Facebook Event on iPhone or iPad

steps.title: Tap the ☰ menu.
steps.content: Tap the ☰ menu. It’s the three horizontal lines at the bottom-right corner. To create a poll on a Facebook event, you must be the creator of the event or have permission to do so.

steps.title: Tap Events on the menu.
steps.content: Tap Events on the menu. A catalog of upcoming events will expand. You may need to tap See more to find it.

steps.title: Tap your event.
steps.content: Tap your event. You'll see your latest event at the top, underneath the Your events header. If you don't see your event, tap See all to view all available events.

steps.title: Tap the Say something… box.
steps.content: Tap the Say something… box. You may have to scroll down a bit to see it. It's in the "Posts" section, right below the "Link Group" option, and just above the existing posts. If prompted, select Post in event to confirm that you want to add the poll to the event, not your news feed. If you don't see the option to "Say something," the event host has not permitted you to create posts on the event. This may be because you haven't yet marked yourself as going to the event. To mark yourself as attending, scroll back up to the top of the event and tap Going .

steps.title: Swipe up on the menu.
steps.content: Swipe up on the menu. It's the menu that begins with "Photo/Video" at the bottom of the screen. This brings up more menu options.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Poll.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Poll . It’s at the bottom of the menu. Look for the orange circle with three vertical lines inside. If you don't see this option, see our troubleshooting section . This feature may not be available in all regions.

steps.title: Enter the poll options.
steps.content: Enter the poll options. By default, you'll start with two options. Click + Add poll option to add more. [1] X Research source Tap the picture icon on the right of each option to upload a photo . To erase an option, tap the X . If you want people to choose only one option, toggle off "Allow people to choose multiple options". Keep in mind that you can't edit the poll once voting has begun.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . This is in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Type your question into the “Ask a question” box.
steps.content: Type your question into the “Ask a question” box. This is the question you’re asking the invitees to answer.

steps.title: Tap Post.
steps.content: Tap Post . It’s at the top-right corner of the screen. This posts the poll to the event page. As people respond, the number of votes on each answer will grow. To see who selected a particular answer, tap its number of votes. You can edit the poll answers after posting—just tap the answer and replace it with your desired text. Or, to remove an answer, tap the X to its right.

steps.title: Update the app.
steps.content: Update the app. You may not be using the latest version of the Facebook app. Open the App Store , tap your initials or profile photo at the upper-right corner, and then scroll down to "Facebook." If you see an Update button, tap it to update Facebook now.

steps.title: Contact Facebook.
steps.content: Contact Facebook. For some users, Facebook has removed the polls option. Facebook hasn't given a clear reason why this is. To add it back, you can send a report. Do the following: Log into Facebook. Click your profile picture. Select Help & support. Select Report a problem.
